programme.title: Track and Field - Day 9 - Evening Session - Athletics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 01/08/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo. It includes the Men's 100m Semifinals and Final, the Women's 100m and Women's Shot Put Victory Ceremony, the Women's Triple Jump and Men's High Jump Finals as well as the Women's 100m Hurdles Semifinals, the Men's 400m Hurdles Semifinals and the Men's 800m Semifinals

programme.title: Determined duo hope to help shape UAE's sporting future
programme.desc: Veteran shooter Sheik Saeed Al Maktoum and road cyclist Yousif Mirza have a crucial role to play to help shape the UAE's sporting future.

programme.title: Fitness influencers Karina Elle and Carmen Morgan train like Olympians
programme.desc: From water polo to sports climbing to ice dancing, watch them try intense Olympic workouts and compete in epic challenges along the way

programme.title: The Olympics On The Record | Episode 4
programme.desc: Devers and Ottey's photo finish, a pole vault gamble, the queens of softball are overthrown, Johnson's historic 200m, and The Dream Team.

programme.title: On the line: Alpine Skiing
programme.desc: Discovering other names, stories and anecdotes behind the mythical Olympic Finals of Alpine Ski

programme.title: Road to Glory - Athletics - The Middle Distance
programme.desc: The stories behind the key moments in middle distance running at the Olympic Games, including stars like Paavo Nurmi and Maria Mutola.

programme.title: Teams Technical Routine - Artistic Swimming | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 06/08/2021 at the Tokyo Aquatics Centre, Tokyo.

programme.title: Teams Free Routine - Artistic Swimming | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 07/08/2021 at the Tokyo Aquatics Centre, Tokyo. ROC claimed Gold, CHN Silver and the Ukraine completed the podium

programme.title: Michael Andrew, Team USA’s Record-Breaking Machine | Splash In
programme.desc: He was a teenager when he started breaking US national age group records. Over the course of his career, he broke more than 100 national records. At Tokyo 2020, he helped team USA break the world record in the 4 x 100 medley relay and won his first Olympic Gold. Soundtrack: Glass Animals, Heat Waves

programme.title: Molly Carlson, Canada’s Brave High Diver | Splash In
programme.desc: She started as a gymnast, then switched to diving, before specializing in high diving (20m) because that is what bravery is to her. Along the journey, she learned how to deal with mental health struggles, an experience that she now shares with her fans as a mental health advocate and founder of the #bravegang. Soundtrack: Bastille, Shut Off The Lights

programme.title: Melissa Wu, the Australian Olympic Diver Who Does Not Give Up | Splash In
programme.desc: At the age of 10 she knew that diving was the sport for her. Throughout her 16 years career, diving helped her overcome depression, anxiety, and lack of self-belief, until she won bronze in Tokyo 2020. Watch her story. Soundtrack: Bree Runway, Pressure.

programme.title: Izzy Thorpe and Kate Shortman, Team GB’s Promising Artistic Swimmers | Splash In
programme.desc: Their mothers competed together years ago, now Izzy and Kate are following in their footsteps. The two best friends are fully in synch in and out of the pool. Tokyo 2020 was their Olympic debut, and they are both looking forward to making a splash at Paris 2024. Soundtrack: Sigrid, Don’t Kill My Vibe

programme.title: Episode 1 : The world-class rivalry of Aquanuts and Aquamaids
programme.desc: Dive into the historic rivalry of two of the elite synchronised swimming clubs in the US as they prepare to compete at nationals.

programme.title: Episode 2 : How two of the world’s best synchro clubs strike a balance
programme.desc: Members of Aquanuts and Aquamaids reveal the sacrifices -- both inside the pool and out -- required for elite synchronised swimming.

programme.title: Artistic Swimming Teams Free Routine | London 2012| Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Join us at the Aquatics Centre during the London Summer Olympic Games in 2012 as Russia claims gold, China wins silver and Spain brings home bronze from the teams free routine in Artistic swimming

programme.title: Women's Rhythmic Gymnastics Ind. All Around| Rio 2016| Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Relive the rhythmic gymnastics individual all around from the Rio Summer Olympic Games in 2016 and follow Margarita Mamun as she wins gold for Russia, Yana Kudryavtseva as she claims silver for Russia, and Ganna Rizatdinova as she takes home bronze for the Ukraine

programme.title: Road to Glory - Gymnastics
programme.desc: Glorious gymnastics moments spanning the history of the Olympic Games, including Olga Korbut, Nadia Comaneci and Yukio Endo.

programme.title: B-Girls Round Robin | Breaking | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The B-Girls Round Robin took place on La Concorde 1, Paris, on 09/08/2024. Syssy (FRA), AMI (JPN), Ayumi (JPN), India (NED), 671 (CHN), Kate (UKR), Zi Ying (CHN), and Nicka (LTU), qualified for the Quarter-Finals.

programme.title: B-Girls Final | Breaking | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The B-Girls Final took place on La Concorde 1, Paris, on 09/08/2024. AMI (JPN) won the Gold, Nicka (LTU) claimed the Silver, and 671 (CHN) won the Bronze.

programme.title: French breakers set the scene for Paris 2024 Olympic Games| Breaking Life
programme.desc: France is a cultural melting pot. It’s also one of the biggest countries for Breaking with more than a thousand battles every year and some of the greatest international competitions. It’s also in Paris 2024 that Breaking will make its Olympic debut. Dany Dann came to France from French Guyana to pursue a life in dance. Now, he juggles early morning shifts as a nurse, daily training and being a father – always with an eye on the next battle. Now reigning national champion, he trains with French national team members B-Girl Carlota and B-Boy Marlone for the WDSF World Breaking Championship in Paris.

programme.title: Young breakers take over the streets of Medellin | Breaking Life
programme.desc: Colombia used to be one of the most dangerous countries in the world but has found new life through a revival in urban arts, becoming a global creative mecca. B-Girl Luma and 4Eskuela hip hop school, where she learnt Breaking and is now a teacher, have been instrumental to this change in Medellin (Colombia). But it’s not been an easy journey for Luma who also had her doubts about what she can really achieve through dancing. By winning international dance events around the world, she is now confident it gave her a career and a drive, also when teaching young kids in her neighbourhood. She is keen to participate to Paris 2024.

programme.title: Teams Acrobatic Routine | Artistic Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Teams Acrobatic Routine took place at Aquatics Centre, Paris, on 07/08/24. Team People's Republic of China won Gold, United States of America won Silver and Spain completed the podium.

programme.title: Duets Technical Routine | Artistic Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Duets Technical Routine took place at the Aquatics Centre, Paris, on 09/08/24.

programme.title: Duets Free Routine Final | Artistic Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Duets Free Routine Final took place at the Aquatics Centre, on 10/08/24. Liuyi Wang/Quianyi Wang (CHN) won Gold, Kate Shortman/Isabelle Thorpe (GBR) won Silver and Bregje de Brouwer/Noortje de Brouwer (NED) completed the podium.

programme.title: Artistic Swimming Teams Free Routine | London 2012| Great Olympic Moments

programme.title: Where are they now? “Las Niñas de Oro” legend lives on
programme.desc: Twenty years after their success in Atlanta 1996, the Spanish rhythmic gymnastics team look back at their amazing journey to new heights.

programme.title: Dakar breakers see new opportunities with Olympic debut| Breaking Life
programme.desc: With a classical and traditional African dance background, B-Boy Zaza is a key member of Power Crew, one of the most successful crew in Senegal. Joined by his young brother Emma, their crew is more like a family and made them travel to major global events. Now a teacher, tasked with navigating the challenges of his community, the dance gives him hope for a brighter future. With Paris 2024 and Dakar Youth Olympic Games in 2026, the elders and next generation alike to build their own future and for the sport as it takes roots in Senegal. Organized by the local dance federation, they participate in the Battle National, featuring some of Senegal’s best emerging talents.

programme.title: Episode 4 : A cruel twist threatens one squad’s dreams
programme.desc: In the final episode, the Aquanuts and Aquamaids go head-to-head as they compete at the most important synchro competition of the year.

programme.title: Duets Technical Routine - Artistic Swimming | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 03/08/2021 at the Tokyo Aquatics Centre, Tokyo. Kolesnichenko/ Romashina (ROC) lead the field into the Free Routine.

programme.title: Duets Free Routine Final - Artistic Swimming | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 04/08/2021 at the Tokyo Aquatics Centre, Tokyo. Kolesnichenko/ Romashina (ROC) claimed the Gold, Huang/Sun (CHN) Silver and Fiedian/Savchuk (UKR) completed the podium

programme.title: Sarah Sjostrom, Sweden’s Swimming Superstar | Splash In
programme.desc: When Sarah slipped and broke her elbow a few months before Tokyo 2020, her fans thought she may not even compete at the Olympics. She fought back, accelerated the recovery, and ended up winning silver in the 50 free. She currently holds 5 World Records and is eyeing Paris 2024 to add new achievements. Soundtrack: Mabel, Let Them Know

programme.title: Michael Bodegas, the Strongman of Italy’s Water Polo Team | Splash In
programme.desc: Olympic Bronze Medallist and World Champion Michael Bodegas says it is the friendship and camaraderie that draw him to water polo. Watch his inspiring story. Soundtrack: ArrDee, Oliver Twist

programme.title: Silvia Solymosyova: The art of walking under water | Her Game
programme.desc: Meet Silvia is a 17-year-old artistic swimmer from Slovakia who makes the most awesome underwater TikTok videos. Featured song: Hallelujah by Oh Wonder

programme.title: Synchro Sisters (Trailer)
programme.desc: Discover the lives of swimmers from the US top two best synchronised swimming clubs, as they prepare to compete at the National Competition.

programme.title: Individual All-Around - Qualification - Morning Session - Rhythmic Gymnastics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 06/08/2021 at the Ariake Gymnastics Centre, Tokyo.

programme.title: Individual All-Around - Qualification - Afternoon Session - Rhythmic Gymnastics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 06/08/2021 at the Ariake Gymnastics Centre, Tokyo.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Rhythmic Gymnast: How Strong is Ekaterina Selezneva?
programme.desc: We have studied the unique physique of Rhythmic Gymnastics Word Champion Ekaterina Selezneva in a sports science lab to uncover what it takes to be an elite gymnast. With the help of Olympian Lolo Jones, each episode of our sports science original series Anatomy of studies the powers and physiques of an elite athlete to find out what makes them special in their sport.

programme.title: Spain’s “Las Niñas de Oro” (extended)
programme.desc: “Las Niñas de Oro” were the youngest Spanish Olympic medallist when they won gold in Atlanta 1996. They continue to inspire younger generations, including the Rio 2016 silver medallist Spanish national team.

programme.title: B-Boys Round Robin | Breaking | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The B-Boys Round Robin took place on La Concorde 1, Paris, on 10/08/2024. Danny Dann (FRA), Jeffro (USA), Amir (KAZ), Victor (USA), Shigekix (JPN), Menno (NED), Lee (NED), Phil Wizard (CAN), qualified for the Quarter-Finals.

programme.title: B-Boys Final | Breaking | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The B-Boys Final took place on La Concorde 1, Paris, on 10/08/2024. Phil Wizard (CAN) won the Gold, Danny Dann (FRA) claimed the Silver, and Victor (USA) won the Bronze.

programme.title: India’s growing breaking scene makes room for B-Girls | Breaking Life
programme.desc: India’s Breaking scene started in the early 2000’s and has since exploded in popularity. While mostly male dominated, women are increasingly accepted and celebrated in the Indian Breaking scene. We meet B-Girl Jo, the two-time BC One India champion from Bangalore, as she travels alone to Mumbai. There, she meets her friend Flying Machine who organizes a community celebration event where B-Girls have a chance to battle it out. As a leader for Indian female hip-hop dancers, Jo reflects on her position in the society. With her own hip-hop and yoga studio and inspired by the challenges she’s already had to overcome, she examines her journey with both excitement and wisdom.

programme.title: Dakar breakers see new opportunities with Olympic debut| Breaking Life
programme.desc: With a classical and traditional African dance background, B-Boy Zaza is a key member of Power Crew, one of the most successful crew in Senegal. Joined by his young brother Emma, their crew is more like a family and made them travel to major global events. Now a teacher, tasked with navigating the challenges of his community, the dance gives him hope for a brighter future. With Paris 2024 and Dakar Youth Olympic Games in 2026, the elders and next generation alike to build their own future and for the sport as it takes roots in Senegal. Organized by the local dance federation, they participate in the Battle National, featuring some of Senegal’s best emerging talents.
